Generate_script_prompt:
Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing as an example.
        Response: I'm Wall-E, and this is your CNBC techcheck Briefing for Monday April 29th. Tesla is asking shareholders to reinstate CEO Elon Musk's $56 billion pay package, which a Delaware judge voided earlier this year. The judge ruled that the record-setting compensation deal was, quote, deeply flawed. Tesla also saying it would ask shareholders to approve moving the company's incorporation from Delaware to Texas. The company has hired a proxy solicitor and plans to spend millions of dollars to help secure votes for the two proposals. Apple CEO Tim Cook says the company plans to look at manufacturing in Indonesia following a meeting with the country's president, Cook telling reporters following the meeting that he spoke with the president about his desire to see manufacturing there and that he believes in the country. The comments come as Apple is pushed to diversify its supply chain with more manufacturing outside of China in countries such as Vietnam and India. Shares of ASML falling today as the company missed its sales forecast but stuck to its full-year outlook. Net sales fell over 21 percent year-over-year, while net income dropped over 37 percent. ASML is highly important to the semiconductor industry as it builds machines that are required for manufacturing chips globally. Last year, weaker demand for consumer electronics hit chipmakers that produce for those devices, which has in turn impacted ASML. That's all for today. We'll see you back here tomorrow.
        Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing using the following news titles and content. Closely follow how CNBC techcheck chooses context to put into the script, the langauge style and sentence structure. Use the same beginning and ending(including mentioning host Wall-E and Monday October 7), and replace CNBC techcheck briefing to 'AI briefing' 
 ""

Response:
Script:
i'm wall-e, and this is your ai briefing for monday, october 7th. google is making headlines as the tech giant faces a new antitrust investigation by the european commission. the inquiry will examine whether google's advertising practices have breached competition rules, potentially impacting their dominant position in the digital advertising market. this marks yet another scrutiny for google, as regulators worldwide continue to question the company's influence and practices.

in other news, amazon has announced plans to invest $4 billion in anthropic, a promising ai startup. this move is seen as a strategic push to expand amazon's ai capabilities and infrastructure, as the competition in the artificial intelligence sector intensifies. with this investment, amazon aims to integrate more advanced ai features into its cloud services, catering to an expanding global demand for ai solutions.

finally, meta platforms reports strong earnings, propelled by increased ad revenue across its family of apps. meta's strategic focus on short-form video content has significantly boosted engagement, driving growth alongside their push into the metaverse and virtual reality. despite economic uncertainties, the company's ability to adapt to changing digital landscapes is proving favorable to investors.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow
Polished Script:
"i'm wall-e, welcoming you to today's tech briefing for monday, october 7th.

google is once again under the magnifying glass as the european commission launches a new antitrust investigation into the tech titan. this inquiry is set to explore whether google's advertising practices have violated competition rules, with potential implications for its leading role in the digital ad market. this investigation adds to the mounting scrutiny google faces globally, as regulators increasingly question its influence and business conduct.

turning to amazon, the company has unveiled a plan to inject $4 billion into anthropic, a burgeoning ai startup. this strategic investment signals amazon's ambitions to enhance its ai capabilities and infrastructure amid growing competition in the artificial intelligence arena. with this financial backing, amazon aims to incorporate more sophisticated ai features into its cloud services, addressing the surging global demand for ai-driven solutions.

meanwhile, meta platforms has reported robust earnings, bolstered by a boost in ad revenue across its suite of apps. meta's strategic pivot towards short-form video content is driving significant user engagement, fueling growth alongside its ventures into the metaverse and virtual reality. despite economic fluctuations, meta's agility in navigating the evolving digital landscape is paying off for investors.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow."
Podcast Title: EP-123 Google Under Scrutiny in Eu Antitrust Probe 🔍, Amazon's $4b Ai Bet on Anthropic 🤖, Meta's Earnings Soar with Video Push 🎥
Podcast Description:
i'm wall-e, welcoming you to today's tech briefing for monday, october 7th.

  • google's antitrust investigation: the european commission launches a new inquiry into google's advertising practices, questioning its influence in the digital ad market.
  • amazon’s ai investment: amazon plans a $4 billion investment in anthropic, an ai startup, to enhance its ai capabilities and cloud services amid rising competition.
  • meta's robust earnings: meta platforms reports strong earnings with increased ad revenue, fueled by strategic focus on short-form video and ventures into the metaverse.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow.
Image Prompt: a cohesive podcast cover image featuring a futuristic urban skyline at dusk. in the foreground, a sleek, reflective skyscraper symbolizes google's presence under scrutiny, with abstract digital patterns swirling around it, representing the antitrust probe. adjacent to the tower, a dynamic cityscape features a glowing, stylized server stack, signifying amazon's hefty investment in ai through anthropic, with digital synapses and neural networks interconnecting across the scene. above, a vibrant, cinematic sky showcases a series of video frames and reels emerging from a digital playground, symbolizing meta's earnings boost through video innovation. the elements merge seamlessly, with a warm, ambient glow uniting the image, reflecting the converging dynamics of these tech giants in the current landscape
